key_insight: Introduce a native sparse voxel-based latent (O-Voxel) that jointly encodes geometry and appearance, enabling compact, structured latents learned directly from 3D data for higher-fidelity 3D generative modeling.
problem_solved: Existing 3D representations struggle to represent complex topologies and detailed appearance while remaining compact and efficient for generation and downstream use.
method: Define O-Voxel: an omni-voxel sparse structure that stores both geometry and appearance signals natively in 3D.
Learn compact, structured latent codes from native 3D assets using the O-Voxel representation (encoder → latent → decoder/generator pipeline).
Leverage sparsity and structure to reduce memory/compute while preserving topology and fine appearance details during generation.
impact: Provides AI/ML practitioners a practical representation for scalable, high-quality 3D generation that balances fidelity and efficiency, easing integration into modeling, rendering, and downstream synthesis pipelines.
visual_elements: Side-by-side comparison: dense voxel vs O-Voxel (memory footprint + topology fidelity annotations)
Pipeline diagram: native 3D asset → O-Voxel encoder → compact structured latent → decoder/generator
Qualitative results grid: generated examples showing complex topology and appearance detail
Bar chart: compute/memory vs fidelity trade-off (baseline representations vs O-Voxel)
paper_title: Native and Compact Structured Latents for 3D Generation
paper_authors: Jianfeng Xiang, Xiaoxue Chen, Sicheng Xu, Ruicheng Wang, Zelong Lv
